did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Correspondence, Manuscripts, Photographs, Printed Materials, Publications
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Vocabulary collection on Central and South American languages. Includes correspondence between Schuller and other members of the Museum of the Native American regarding the collection. Five boxes of 3x5 index cards with vocabulary items noted along with bibliographic source or notations in other languages. Six boxes boxes of half sheets with vocabulary items, words, definition, and pronunciation, organized by "root" or what appears to be subject in some cases. A note from Schuller says that this is a comparative dictionary of Maya Quiche and Carib-Aruak containing 40,000 words of all known dialects. Two boxes of manuscripts, notes for publications, and other vocabularies. Includes comparative vocabularies, grammar information, phonetic transcriptions, and glossaries of Mayan and Cholti languages. Published items including dictionaries and texts regarding Central American languages, some in Spanish. Index included in Box L.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Rodolfo or Rudolph, Schuller was a linguist who studied Mexican, Central and Southern American Indians. He served on the faculty of the National University in Mexico City. A large collection of his ethnological studies and photographs were acquired by Tulane University, in the 1920s shortly after Schuller moved to New Orleans. The papers are held in their Latin American Library.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Vocabulary collection on Central and South American languages. Includes correspondence between Schuller and other members of the Museum of the Native American regarding the collection. Five boxes of 3x5 index cards with vocabulary items noted along with bibliographic source or notations in other languages. Six boxes boxes of half sheets with vocabulary items, words, definition, and pronunciation, organized by "root" or what appears to be subject in some cases. A note from Schuller says that this is a comparative dictionary of Maya Quiche and Carib-Aruak containing 40,000 words of all known dialects. Two boxes of manuscripts, notes for publications, and other vocabularies. Includes comparative vocabularies, grammar information, phonetic transcriptions, and glossaries of Mayan and Cholti languages. Published items including dictionaries and texts regarding Central American languages, some in Spanish. Index included in Box L.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Rodolfo R. Schuller papers, #9172. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

arrangement.head: SERIES LIST
arrangement.p:
Series I. Vocabulary organized by root
Boxes 10A-F

Series II. Vocabulary cards with bibliographic information
Boxes 10G-K

Series III. Papers and Correspondence
Boxes 10L-M

did.unittitle: Series I. Vocabulary organized by root

scopecontent.p: Folder titles of the vocabulary are not all inclusive and are copied directly without verification of their contents. Due to poor handwriting on the folders there may be errors in spelling. Folder titles are made up of a "root" and contain words using that "root", followed by English definitions. There seems to be no order at all in any of the vocabularies and the folder titles have vague relationships to their contents. Presuming original order of the material has been maintained this would appear to be a naming and ordering system that only Schuller understood.

did.unittitle: Ama, ma, vua, maize and related ideas
Is, to see, sight, eagle, bird, and so forth
Ek, black, cold, and related ideas
Eu, teu cold; ras, fresh green etc.
Ka-ca-koi-cai-tsa-ka, tsa ta, sa, fish and so on
Tan, ak, kat, hol, fire and related ideas
Kui, tree, hui fruits, flower, mountain, Maya
Ki-si-ci-tsi, hot, sun, fire, tree, forest, etc.
Ok-uk, us, is, to drink, throat, recipient
Uh-ux-uk, to drink, smoke, breatje, to kiss and so on
ia, ya, was, quas, iya, water
Kot ko akat, dance, drum, mask
Thunder, lightning, rain, storm, and related ideas
At, ata, had, hot, sun, tree, wood, house
Ka-ch-tsa-sa, Ke-ki, stone, bone, hard, etc., ak-hag, xak, ok, uk, ek, ik
Ca-sa, stone, hard, bone, tooth, and so on
Sa, stone, tooth, earth, bone, hard
pac, pok, pox, po, stone, bone, hard, mud, etc.
Ok-uk, ots, oc, stone, bone, hard, etc.
E, te, ek,ok, ce-ke, et, tet, it, cen-ken, gen, stone, tooth, earth, hard, bone, cave
Ka-ak-aka-aga, ca, akal, agal, sa, akua, gua, tsa, kua, gua
Ko, ok, ku, tso, ots, uk, yo, kuk, xu, so, su, to, tu
Ke, to, ye-he, ki, ti, yi
Series II. Vocabulary cards with bibliographic information

scopecontent.p: 3x5 cards of vocabulary, subject, and names. Divided into unlabeled sections with no apparent or decipherable order.

did.unittitle: Index, printed guides, calendars for the collection. Provenance information.
Lists of materials offered for sale by Schuller; correspondence between Schuller and Hodge re the acquisition of the collection, etc.

scopecontent.p: Includes photos of Schuller.

did.unittitle: About 5,000 words taken from each one of the known Maya-K'ice (Quiche) languages. A semantic study of different archaic Maya- K'ice forms.

scopecontent.p: 434 large sheets. A few have notes on versos, a few inserted small sheets.

did.unittitle: Maya-K'ice elements in a series of Karib-Aruak (Arawak) languages, embracing the archaic forms in all known Maya-K'ice tongues.

scopecontent.p: 138 large sheets.
152 sheets. Materials taken from Stoll, Rockstroh, Sapper, and so forth, each sheet dedicated to a particular word (man, woman, etc.) with definitions for 1-22A [languages?] on each sheet.
77 sheets, unpublished. Compiled from a manuscript in the possession of Tulane University.

did.unittitle: Extract of the Doctrina Christiana in the Mexican Indian language

scopecontent.p: 9 sheets, at the end of the above Spaish-Totonaca glossary. Annotated by R. Schuller.

did.unittitle: Maya-K'ice studies, mostly a linguistic comparison of Maya-K'ice forms with the respect.

scopecontent.p: 96 large sheets. Includes: Archaic roots Mixe-Ayook (Balimar) p.1-8. Maya-K'ice studies: Sexual parts p.9-11; U1- atole, and related ideas p.12-13; Roots: Ac-aci, etc. p.14-23; Vocabulary from Steinen, Leipzig 1892 p.24-28; Roots: Kua, etc. p.29-49; Extracts from Steinen, Greenberg p.50-59; Extracts from the Motul Maya dictionary (ms, Peabody Museum, Harvard) p. 60-78; Extracts from "Brebe Noticia de 10s vocablos mas usuales de la lengua Kakchiquel," Peabody Museum ms. p.79-96.

did.unittitle: A study of the linguistic map of Hondorus, C.A., according to Indian geographical nomenclature.

scopecontent.p: 187 sheets, containing several thousand Indian place names. Materials gathered by R. Schuller in 1927 which were to be published to show the geographical distribution of the different Indian languages of Honduras.

did.unittitle: Extracts made from Membreño, Alberto. Nombres Geográficos Indigenas de la República de Honduras. 1901. 26p.
Guia de Agrimensores o sea Recopilacion de Leyes Agrarias. Por Antonio Vallejo. Tegucigalpa. Tipografia Nacional. Avenida Cervantes Número 42. 1911.

scopecontent.p: 43 sheets

did.unittitle: Maya-K'ice elements in Zoque-Mixe taken from Lenguas Indigenas de Centro America by Ferraz y Fernandez Guardia

scopecontent.p: 19 sheets

did.unittitle: Mam glossary taken from Arte y Vocabulario de la lengua Mame by Father Diego de Reynoso

scopecontent.p: 21 sheets with annotations.
7 sheets

did.unittitle: Comparative Vocabularies of different Maya-K'ice Dialects

scopecontent.p: 9 sheets. Four languages, Aguacateca, Mam, Jacalteca, Cuxe.

did.unittitle: Extracts of Stoll's Ixil tract, a Maya-K'ice language

scopecontent.p: 61 sheets with annotations by Schuller.

did.unittitle: Contribucción a1 Estudio de Las Lenguas Aborigines de El Salvador. (Especialmente de la antigua Provincia de Chaparrastique-San Miguel), por Rudolf Schuller.

scopecontent.p: 54 sheets.

did.unittitle: Pipil poetry and a short vocabulary from El Salvador, C.A.

scopecontent.p: Obtained from an Indian of Izalco, 1925.

did.unittitle: Facsimile of the Pineda Map of America, 1519.

scopecontent.p: From Navarrete "Coleccion de Documentos". Madrid.

did.unittitle: On the value of the Spanish money (coins) and weight of the earlier part of the 16th century.

scopecontent.p: Notebook titled Medidas Pesos Moneda with inserts. Compiled by R. Schuller according the most reliable sources of information.

did.unittitle: Correspondenz über den Historiographen Ulrich Schmiedel.

scopecontent.p: Letters, unpubl., on the historian Ulrich Schmiedel between R. Schuller and Dr. Mondschein of Straubing, the birthplace of that famous chronicler of the first and the most important Spanish settlement in the countries of River Platte, (1535-1555.)

did.unittitle: Notes on Uspanteca (Pokonchi dialect) of Guatemala.

scopecontent.p: 43 sheets

did.unittitle: Notes on the Tzotzil language of Chiapas.

scopecontent.p: According to Jose Maria Sanchez, 1895 and others, 21 sheets.

did.unittitle: Notes on the linguistic map of El Salvador, C.A.
Notes mostly geographical , or place-names of Indian origin.

scopecontent.p: Unpublished, 10 large sheets.

did.unittitle: Extracts from Father Beltrán, Maya grammar.

scopecontent.p: 1859 (2nd edition) with notes by R. Sch. 40 sheets.

did.unittitle: Extract from a very short Trique glossary, with place names in Mexican and in Trique (native tongue of Oaxaca).

scopecontent.p: Copy of an unpubl. ms. fragment dealing with the Ixil language, a Maya- K'ice dialect of Guatemala, C.A. 10 sheets with notes by R. Sch.

did.unittitle: Folklore: Native poetry of South America including Bolivia.

scopecontent.p: 148 sheets collected during many years in South America partly from very scarce broad-sides, and partly from mss. sources.

did.unittitle: Grammar and vocabulary 1685-1695 from Moran, Francisco. Art en lengua Ch'olti, 1695.

scopecontent.p: Annotated copy of ms. in Gates collection , Tulane University . Also included: parts of the human body; Indian community, family and so forth; ethnography; nature; adjective attributive; verbs; participles; colours.

did.unittitle: 29 negatives of the famous collection of gold objects from burial-places in Caldas, the Quimbaya region of Central Colombia, S.A.
13 Maps of different Middle American republics, from Petermanns Geographische Mitteilungen.

scopecontent.p: Maps are folded and are large. Maps by Dr. Carl Sapper.
Taken by R. Sch. at Popayan, Southern Colombia, S.A.

did.unittitle: Place names of southern Colombia, all of Indian origin, elements for a linguistic chart of that section of Colombia.
Geographical names, mostly of the Choco languages of central and western Colombia.

scopecontent.p: From a scarce printed book by Uribe

did.unittitle: List of place names of Indian origin of northern Colombia, Cartagena.
Notes on the relationship of the Xinca language of Guatemala to Maya-K'ice.

scopecontent.p: Unpublished linguistic comparisons, with notes which the author intended to publish but left unfinished.

did.unittitle: An unpublished account made in Latin by the Jesuit Father Sanmartoni (Szehtmartony)

scopecontent.p: A Hungarian, former astronomer of the Indians of the Jesuit Missions on the Upper Amazon and its tributaries. XVIII century. Original preserved at the National Library, Rio de Janeiro. See Catalogo da Exposigao Brazileira.

did.unittitle: Notes on entirely unknown Indian languages of Ecuador, S.A.

scopecontent.p: Gathered by R. Schuller, from "Relaciones Geograficas."

did.unittitle: Catalina II, the Empress of Russia, and her relations to American linguistics.

scopecontent.p: Notes on a very scarcely known document.

did.unittitle: On the Motilon Indians, of Western Venezuela.

Unpublished ms. from the Munoz Collection, Madrid. Copied by R. Schuller. 1910.
Unknown if this was published. 5 sheets (Segue o vocabulario do Rio Putumayo).

From the handwritten annotations in Vocabulario en lengua Castelland y Mexicans, 1555 by Alonso de Molina. 1544 sheets.

List of contents of folios of unidentified ms. from Ville de Besançon, Bibliothéque Publique made by George Gazier, conservateur and letters from staff there. News clippings about Schuller.
